content: Why do we sometimes write "lol" instead of "laugh out loud"?

"Lol" is an acronym for "laugh out loud," but over time, its usage has evolved in digital communication. People often write "lol" to acknowledge a joke or to express mild amusement, even if they're not literally laughing out loud. It has become a standard way to show that you find something funny or to soften the tone of a message. So, while it started as an abbreviation, it's now more of a shorthand expression in online conversations.
